page.title: 19LOWER & SCHOOL HOUSE FARMS
page.content: Lower Farm,owned by Mr Wilkins,has 125 acres.Mr Wilkin owns 90 acres and rents 35 acres.He manages the farm himself.Work begins at 5.00 a.m. with the help of one full time and one part time helper. He has 80 cows which yield 4500 litres of milk per year and he has 20 heifers and 3 horses.All the fields are grassland.The farmhouse is 400 yrs old.Mr Wilkins bought the farm in 1964 for Â£11,000 and estimates its present value at Â£200,000. School House Farm,owned by Mr.Young,is 110 years old.Mr.Young has lived there for 59 years.He owns 30 acres of land split up into 8 fields.The only crop is hay.The animals kept are 15 beef cattle,7 cows including 4 jerseys,2 heifers in calf,1 bull,12 calves and 4 horses.So mostly the farming they do is beef cattle.
